newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for March 3.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for March 3.

text.p: Mexican port Coatzacoalcos in Veracruz state and Pajaritos crude shipping port under its jurisdiction were reported shut Monday, the Communications and Transport Ministry said in its 1000 local/1600 GMT daily meteorological report.
The port was shut Sunday at 1535 local/2135 GMT because of winds from the north at 45 km per hour and waves nine feet high.

Dos Bocas in Tabasco state was also reported shut to petroleum shipments because of high waves that prevented the guiding tug boats and pilot ships from sailing, a port official said. The port reopened for larger ships at 0940 local/1540 GMT Monday after closing at 1600 local/2200 GMT on Sunday.
Cayo Arcas crude port in Campeche state remained open amid calmer weather, a port official said.
Nautla, Veracruz and Frontera were closed to smaller tourism and fishing boats, the ministry said
Ships were warned by the ministry of high winds and waves along the coasts of Tamaulipas, Veracruz and Tabasco states.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean and Pacific Coast.
Cold front in northern Baja California peninsula sending winds of 10 to 20 knots (19 to 38 km/11 to 22 miles per hour) to region. Rest of coast experiencing mild winds below 15 km per hour.

Colder temperatures and light rains along coasts of Tamaulipas, Veracruz and Tabasco states, with winds of 15 to 20 knots (28 to 38 km/17 to 22 miles per hour), gusts up to 47 km/28 miles per hour and waves six to nine feet high.
Hot and partly cloudy with moderate east and southeast winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
